column9: I have copd this med has proven very useful to keep lungs clearer when used with albuterol treatment 1/2 ml in nebulizer with albuterol my lungs stay much clearer than just albuterol

column2: maleforgod, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medication is so gross and hard to swallow without gagging from the taste and I can't see any results from it.

column2: mad_bookworm, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I caught a cold while traveling in Europe.  As always, it settled in my lungs and I coughed for weeks.  Finally, in Italy, I went into a pharmacy and described my condition to the pharmacist.  He gave me a package of something called Sobrepin (dosage unknown) which is acetylcysteine. Within three days, the cough was GONE.It's a pity one cannot buy Sobrepin in the U.S.  I have just purchased a form of acetylcysteine called NAC, over the counter, and hopefully it will work as well.
I am living in Thailand and there are some things in the air that cause episodes of asthma during  tennis and I love the game and being in the outside air causes me problems at certain seasons.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hi - In August 2007, I contracted a "small" pneumonia/bronchitis.  Fortunately, a good friend who is a physician gave this to me.  It works much better than Mucinex or any cough medicine w/ guiaifenesin.  I am upset because I cannot get it in the U.S.

column2: JMH, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have extrinsic allergic alveolitis complicated with asthma and COPD.  When occasional courses of 600mg daily are taken (max 7 days) my breathing becomes much easier and mucus is coughed up more easily
